sentence: What do a woman and a bar have in common? liquor in the front, poker in the back.
explanation: A bar is a place that serves alcoholic drinks.
first_new_sentence: The bar was crowded with people enjoying their evening.
second_new_sentence: The committee has set up a bar against any further changes to the proposal.

sentence: This joke meets the criteria: the word bar has two meanings, both spelled the same way and existing as a single word in the dictionary. The first sentence reflects its meaning as a place serving drinks, while the second illustrates the prohibition context. If you need more jokes or have additional criteria, feel free to ask!
